detailed_info.name: Chlorhexidine Digluconate
detailed_info.description: Chlorhexidine being poorly soluble in water is often used in its salt form (here Digluconate) in drugs or cosmetics. Chlorhexidine digluconate is a skin antiseptic used in Biseptine. In cosmetics, she is on the list of authorized curators (Appendix V). In deodorants, it can play an active role to limit the proliferation of bacteria responsible for body odor. In toothpastes, in the same way, it can help limit plaque formation.
detailed_info.regulation: The maximum permissible concentration in ready-to-use cosmetic preparations is 0.3% (in chlorhexidine).

functions.name: Antimicrobial
functions.description: Helps slowing the growth of micro-organisms on the skin and counteracts the development of microbes

functions.name: Oral care/hygiene agent
functions.description: Provides cosmetic effects to the oral cavity (cleaning, deodorization and protection)

functions.name: Preservative
functions.description: Inhibits the development of microorganisms in cosmetic products.
